title: Transposable element variation in Arabidopsis: Far Eastern accessions are loaded up
content: Evolution is driven by changes in DNA sequence, including single nucleotide mutations and larger sequence changes such as structural variants. Transposable elements (TEs) are mobile DNA sequences that can insert in coding and regulatory regions, potentially altering gene function. Due to their disruptive effect on genome integrity, most TEs are kept silent. However, transposition events still occur and may increase the genetic load.
